original:
The bioeconomy encompasses various forms of bioenergy, including biohydrogen, biofuels, and algae fuel. According to the World Bioenergy Association, renewable energy sources accounted for 17.8% of gross final energy consumption. Among these, bioenergy, derived from biological sources, represents the largest segment. In 2017, bioenergy constituted 70% of total renewable energy consumption.
